ratings.comment: Interesting content. Lectures and discussions were graded for attendance. 3 exams and one paper. Exams had short answer and timeline, and weren't difficult if you reviewed. The paper at the end was 8 pages for non-honors, 15 for honors and open-ended. Lots of reading homework. Prof. was accessible outside class and cared about student success.

Definitely recommend taking a class with Prof Iber. I'm not a history major and just took his class for a gen ed so I think I would've found the class material to be boring if it had been taught by anyone else, but he presents the information in a very engaging manner. Grade is based on three midterms, a final paper, and TopHat attendance points.

Absolute gem of a professor. Would recommend to anyone. Readings are heavy but helpful for understanding concepts, and need to do readings for tests. But prof is very funny and helpful and willing to work with students to succeed

Latin American history has lots of longs textbook and PDF readings, so be prepared, and there are reading checks at the start of every class so be prepared  His lectures are interesting and he incorporates some good humor, but be prepared for him to express his political views. Overall a great professor that I've enjoyed!

Second time having professor Iber, and I enjoyed my time even more. He has a background in Latin American history/politics, making him perfect for this course. He balanced drier readings with interesting movies, preventing the class from ever feeling boring. He's also very funny and engages with the class well.
Professor Iber is really knowledgable about what he teaches and is clearly very passionate about it--which makes his lectures super interesting. He's funny asf too. Highly recommend.
Great class, even online. Professor Iber has a great teaching style, and manages to keep class engaging and open.

Professor Iber did a fantastic job of making the subject of history interesting. I took this class as a general course, and while it was fairly easy coursework, Professor Iber made it interesting through amazing lectures. Overall, great course!

I took History 102 for the fall semester and Prof Iber was amazing! I found the class to be as thorough as possible while still covering many topics and eras! He was funny and made lecture super easy to pay attention to! I would definitely take a class again with Iber!!

While I found the class to be a bit shallow, I thought Prof. Iber was fantastic! He was really thoughtful with his approach to dark topics such as the treatment of Native Americans and minorities in American society. Also, he's a prof. who doesn't mind you making jokes in the chat (as long as long as they're actually funny). A solid prof. for sure!

Iber was a great professor. He cares about his students and allowed them to basically determine what they want their grade to be (based off of how much effort they put into the class). There was a lot of reading involved which usually accompanies every history class so that was to be expected. The 3 quizzes we had were pretty easy.
I loved his class! It's hard to try and switch to online with little experience but I thought he did very well. Great class and great professor!
Professor Iber is definitely one of the best lecturers I've ever had, and his grading scale makes it pretty easy to do well provided you're actually trying.

I've taken multiple classes from professor and absolutely love him. He has helped me develop the way I view the world and live my life, i'm not exaggerating. He is very relaxed, understanding, empathetic, and knowledgeable. 10/10 greatest professor I have ever had.
The 2 comments below even got the course numbers wrong. Prof Ibers class is good but not great, but Im going to give five stars to boost the score. Scammers go away!
After a semester I can't recall what have I learned from this class. After TOPHAT and 100+ pages readings/week. What have I learned???

The instructor often uses video clips, documentaries and debates to fill up lecture time. Mediocre course design and relies heavily on opinions. No communication whatsoever, stubborn and petty. On the bright side of things, show up & pass, easy material and grading. Though definitely not the best bang of your buck, avoid at all cost.

Prof. Iber is a very knowledgeable person who doesn't always make the best use of class time. I found we would get very distracted by Top Hat or discussions which left little time for actual lecture. That seems harsh but really my complaint is I wish we had covered more things in class because what we did do was fascinating, we just didn't do much.

Patrick was an awesome prof that truly has a passion for history and its importance. Although he assigned a great deal of reading, he realized that it was too much, and he cut it down towards the end of the semester. The two midterms and final were all extremely fair. He ensures that through lecture and discussion, you are very well prepared.

Patrick was my favorite prof this semester. He doesn't like to lecture for 75 minutes just as students don't like to be lectured for 75 minutes, so the culture breaks are fun and interesting. He is hilarious and lively to the point that I was sad to miss one lecture. The two midterms and final are by no means terrible, especially with discussion.

I would recommend this course only if you are super interested in history. I took it to fulfill my history requirement, & this class was honestly too much for me. He expects you to read about 100 pages/week (mostly online) & buy about 8 books. You can for sure get a B if you show up and neglect the readings, but this class is by NO means an easy A.

Patrick has been an amazing lecturer this past semester and has presented material in a way that is interesting to the students. He is extremely flexible in working around his students schedules and often available to meet or help with concerns
